result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Steven Tuura II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
JOC amended 06-22-2022: Probation extended for 2 years from 4/26/2022 to 4/26-2024 or until court obligations are completed. 
JOC amended 02-20-2020: Probation extended for 2 years from 04/26/2020 to  04/26/2022 or until court obligations are completed.
Meet with DOC representative within 48 hours.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be determined.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 8:05 a.m.

Amended 06-17-2016:  Restitution and surcharges totaling $27,698.00.

Court costs totaling $518.00.    If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
As a convicted felon, prohibited from possessing a firearm.
Cognitive Behavior Class as directed by DOC agent.

No contact with G.B., her family or residence.    Defendant not to frequent establishments whose primary source of income is from the sale of alcoholic beverages.    Defendant must not consume or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.    As a convicted felon, prohibited from voting until civil rights restored.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety and no consumption of illegal drugs.    Take all medications as prescribed and take them only as prescribed.  Random UA's.    Defendant is to submit DNA sample.
AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations of Counselor.

timeConds.notes:
JOC amended 10-29-2018: Order of Department of corrections and the court that Defendant to serve 30 days conditional jail time. 

Huber release granted, hours and conditions to be set by Sheriff's Dept. where jail sentence will be served.  

Amended 10-25-2016:  Day for day credit for successfully completed jail programming.

Amended 11-29-2016:  Upon proof of employment, work release granted.  No child care release.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held 04-26-2016 before Judge Anderson; filed by Julie Brown, Court Reporter

Defendant Timothy Steven Tuura in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA; have stip, $25,180.00 value of restitution owed by Mr. Tuura.  Mr. Tuura has agreed to give locations of where property was pawned; some of the property could be located and recovered.  Hoffman agrees, Def. agrees.  
Timothy Tuura sworn and questioned by Atty Hoffman.  Witness reviews a list of property previously marked as exhibit #1; witness indicates the co-def. may have taken some of these items, def. states he did not take any of the gaming items, fireworks, specific paperwork listed in the first 4 pages.  Did not take any of the items in the list titled assorted 1 and assorted 2 except for the t.v, ring set, emerald ring, emerald & diamond ring, 2 engagement rings; tells the court where these items were taken.  The money/coins listed were reviewed, witness indicates which items were taken and where pawned.  Cross by DA; only on the property one time; transported in witness's car; all items taken were brought to the pawn and gold shops indicated; was with co-def. when items were brought to the shops; saw receipts for the rings he pawned.  No re-direct.  Witness excused.  No other witnesses by defense.  Court; orders $25,180.00 restitution owed by Mr. Tuura; amend JOC.  
Motion to modify sentence:  Hoffman recites history of case and reviews basis for motion.  Had attempted the option for Mr. Tuura be part of the RRTC/FTC programs with portion of jail sentence stayed for successful completion of the program.  Asks the Court to reconsider staying 3 months of the 12 month sentence for successful completion of RRTC program.  DA responds; stip to the facts of when this case was charged and plea taken within 3 months of filing charges.  Mrs. Tuura already receiving programing on JC case and Mr. Tuura receiving programing w/DHS.  Court explains how FTC is anticipated to work with parents/families.  Court would like to review a transcript of sentencing hearing to fully understand basis for sentence ordered; reviews thoughts/questions court had in his mind at the sentencing hearing; will take motion under advisement; orders transcript from sentencing hearing.
Affidavit of Craig L. Rudd
Defendant's notice of motion and motion to modify sentence
Exhibit #1
Minutes Filed
